modName: HDT and Bodyslide conversion for Frigus' Tera Armor Collection CBBE
summary: This is a conversion for Frigus Tera Armor Collection CBBE standalone to be used with bodyslide, including zap sliders, with HDT PE.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5]What is this?
[/size][size=3]This is a conversion of Frigus' Tera Armor Collection CBBE to HDT PE and Bodyslide including zap sliders.


[size=5]Requirements
[/size][/size]SKSE v1.7.1 [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/url]
Realistic Ragdolls and Force - realistic force [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/601/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/601/[/url]
XPMS Extended  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/[/url]
HDT Physics Extensions v14.28 [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53996/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53996/[/url]
The original mod by Frigus v1.3 [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29411/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29411/[/url]
Bodyslide  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/[/url]
CBBE v3.3 [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/[/url]

[size=5]Installation
[/size][size=3]Install with NMM as long as you have your Caliente Tools folder in your data folder and it contains Bodyslide.
Otherwise download manually and install in the appropriate Bodyslide folders.
Build the armors in bodyslide.

[size=5]Things to know
[size=3]Should you need assistance with installing the HDT body or creating an HDT body I will try to help you to the best of my abilities.
Resources and advice should be available on the Bodyslide mod page.

I am not using any HDT animation mods, HDT alone gives me all that is necessary.
You can try HDT animation mods or mods that alter the HDT xml file, just keep in mind this conversion was made without them.

Pay attention to any skeleton altering mods you may have installed, they may interfere with the skeleton required to make HDT work, such as Belt Fastened Quivers, there is an animation only version available.

The correct skeleton you should get by installing Realistic Ragdolls and Force first.
Then XPMS Extended, let XPMS Extended overwrite Realistic Ragdolls and Force, XPMSE should allow you to place your quivers back on your belt.

HDT Physics you should get by installing SKSE 1.7.1, look at Gophers videos for proper installation.
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37xAMUQc1oY&list=PL96C073B0B8BFC01D&index=102]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37xAMUQc1oY&list=PL96C073B0B8BFC01D&index=102[/url]
[/size][size=3]The video contains other things, so be patient, even though it mentions SKSE v1.7.0 it is valid for 1.7.1 regarding the memory blocks.
HDT Physics Extensions is an SKSE plugin, so that is why you need SKSE.
[/size]
[/size][/size][size=3]Extreme bodyslide presets are not supported at this time.
I may adjust the sliders for extreme presets, however I just don't use them, I simply do not feel like letting my followers
run around with a body that could be a weapon of mass destruction.
So there will be clipping on those presets.

Even though this is a skimpy armor conversion and the zap sliders allow for nudity, please do not upload any pictures with nudity in them.

Should you find an issue with clipping let me know, some things are already present in the original Tera armors and can only be fixed to an extend. I may try to fix issues if I think it is possible without distorting the armor meshes until they start to look funny.

This mod works great with this conversion, especially if you are a female character ( uhmmm.....did I have to mention that? ), but it is a great mod in any case.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57859/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57859/[/url]


[/size]


[size=5]Credits
[size=3]Frigus for his original mod and kind permission for this conversion.
VRDaphni for testing, wonderful screenshots and general support.
Groovtama for XPMS Extended.
Caliente for CBBE and Bodyslide.
ChronoTrigger77 for most helpful tips and hints.
Ousnius for tutorials.
Gopher for being a teacher of the best kind.
Bethesda for the best....ish game ever made.

[size=4]My other conversion
[/size][/size][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59605/][size=3]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59605/[/size][/url]
[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61141/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61141/[/url][/size]
